awards.title: 4 Gold and Silver Medals at (Inter)National Philosophy Olympiads
awards.description:
During the Philosophy Olympiad, students are given three hours two write an academic essay based on  a  philosophical quote that they are given at the start of the session. Essays should be written in English and without any aids (literature or online searches). Prizes include gold, silver and bronze medals, as well as Honorable Mentions.

- 2015: Silver Medal at the International Philosophy Olympiad in Tartu, Estonia & 
- 2015: Silver Medal at the National Philosophy Olympiad, the Netherlands
- 2014: Silver Medal at the International Philosophy Olympiade (IPO) in Vilnius, Lithuania
- 2014: Gold Medal at the National Philosophy Olympiad, the Netherlands
awards.issuer: National and International Philosophy Olympiad (NPO, IPO)

projects.title: Community & Consultancy Project: Ameliorating the Quality of Death of patients with Adult Congenital Heart Disease
projects.description:
In collaboration with Prof. dr. Roos-Hesselink, Dr. Cuypers and others at the department of Congential Cardiology of the Erasmus Medical Centre, as well as dr. Heijnsdijk from the department of Public Healthcare at the Erasmus Medical Centre. 

Patients with Congenital Heart Disease (CHD) are more likely to reach adulthood due to ever-improving treatments. However, little appears to be known about End-of-Life (EoL) guidance in adult CHD (ACHD) patients. What is the current situation regarding EoL conversations in patients with ACHD?

The project consisted of a field study, as well as literary research. The field study consisted of creating questionnaires for patients with ACHD and for doctors of the department of Congenital Cardiology at Erasmus MC. Qualitative research was conducted on the basis of the results of these questionnaires. The literature search consisted of searching for relevant articles on EoL interviews with ACHD-patients.

The conclusion of this research was that the current situation around EoL conversations with ACHD patients leaves much to be desired. In addition to a lack of documentation regarding EoL interviews, there is also a discrepancy in perceived incidence of EoL interviews between patients and doctors. Advice was geared towards encouraging the creation of uniform, yet individualistic, strategies for the EoL conversation.

This work was graded with ‘Excellent’.

projects.title: Research Project: Weet U Wat U Slikt? : teaching health-related vocabulary and essential medical knowledge to functionally illiterate adult immigrants from Delfshaven, Rotterdam.
projects.description:
Translation: Do You Know What Medication You Take? 

I co-organized, participated, and performed research within this research project. The aim of this project was to give medical and linguistic information to low-literate residents with a non-Western background from Delfshaven, Rotterdam. 

Residents with a non-Western background and functional illteracy were invited to participate. The participants (n= 305) followed a program of five lessons in the Dutch language and five theoretical lessons about medication and health. These classes were given by medical students who we recruited to volunteer as teachers in the project. Before and after the program, participants were tested on questions linked to the subjects that were covered in the medication and health lessons. 

Scientific research into the effect of this was titled: 'The effect of teaching health-related vocabulary and essential medical knowledge to functionally illiterate adults'. Results showed that teaching health-related vocabulary and essential medical knowledge to functionally illiterate adults in Delfshaven, the Netherlands led to an increase of 25% in theoretical knowledge.

projects.title: It is written in the stars: the efficiency of iPSC-derived astrocytes using defined factors
projects.description:
As a Junior Researcher at the Department of Neuroscience, Erasmus MC, I set out to study the efficiency of deriving astrocytes from Neural progenitor cells (NPCs) through induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC) technology, as compared to literature and in-house methods. 

This research went on to win several awards, which are in the 'Honors & Awards' section.

profile_positions.title: Year Representation

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Studiebegeleiding Leiden is specialised in offering high-quality exam preparation courses for students in the final year of secondary school ((Higher General Secondary Education (HAVO) and Pre University Education (VWO)). The organisation started as a collaboration with Leiden University, over twenty years ago. Apart from exam preparation courses, SSL offers a wide range of other courses for both students in the final year of secondary school, and for secondary school teachers. 

As a Senior Teacher, I am resposible for a group of ±4 Assistant Teachers and a class of ±25 students during exam preparation courses. During these courses, I teach classes ±6 hours per day, attempting to have as much interaction with the students as possible. Apart from these lectures, I coach the Assistant Teachers on how to get the best out of their students, out of their colleagues, and out of themselves.

For this position, I have attended a 6-month training course (± 4 hours a week). The training course focussed on presenting and managing a team. As the training was fully one-on-one, it was possible to extensively discuss and work on improving my weaknesses, and further develop my strengths.
profile_positions.title: Senior Teacher in English & German

profile_positions.description: As an Assistant Teacher, I am responsible for the coaching of a group of 5-10 students during exam preparation courses in either English or German. The goal of this coaching is to help students with gaining the necessary knowledge, skills, and confidence to succesfully -and eventually, independently- answer their exam questions. This is done through offering the students personalized feedback based on the contents of their work, as well as individual, personal attention to garner a positive mindset.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Teacher in English & German

company.name: Dutch Surgical Society for Medical Students

profile_positions.company: Dutch Surgical Society for Medical Students
profile_positions.description:
The Dutch Surgical Society for Medical Students provides masterclasses and workshops for its 550 members nationwide. Open lectures, symposia, and conferences are also accessible for non-members. Every medical faculty has its own subdivision that beholds 50 members and a three member board, of which Rotterdam is one.

This position involves organising masterclasses, workshops, seminars, symposia, excursions, international summer schools, visits to congresses, and opportunities for scientific research on the surgical discipline as well as learning other skills - including communication, research and collaboration.
profile_positions.title: President

volunteer_experiences.description: Serving as a host to high school students during this three-day event meant to educate youngsters on the field of medicine in general and the HIV/AIDS epidemic in particular. With speakers such as Nobel Prize winner Françoise Barré-Sinoussi and Timothy Brown - the first person who has been cured of HIV/AIDS.
Giving medical education as part of the Honours Class, with the aim of bringing primary school students in contact with Medicine and thus fostering an interest in academia at an early age.
Weekly tutoring to grammar schoolers who are struggling with various classes by students who are excelling in said classes.
Tutoring and guiding primary school students with learning difficulties.
